page.title: 09Hamble again four
page.content: Simon Le Bon,76ft racing yacht designed to take part in the Whitbread round the world race in 85' Hamble point marina,on the west bank of the river Hamble offers the usual marina services with spaces for visitors,and a,large chandlery.This year it has been the home of the virgin Atlantic Chalenger,the speed-boat designed to win back the { {blue-ribbon}for Britian,crossing the alantic in record time.Numerous other boatyards and chandlers line the banks of the river Hamble,as well as some private houses. Further up the river past the two river bridges it becomes more rural, and the suburban houses and marinas give way to fields and trees.The upper Hamble country park is bordered on one side by the river.The scouts and guides make use of the oppertunity by
